content: NAV per share at the end of June was $16.02 or $0.14 or 9.9% increase quarter over quarter, the $0.14 increase was attributable to $0.10 cents of net share gain on the portfolio and net investment income per share of $0.03. Regarding liquidity, given the continued improvement in the quality of our investment portfolio, our liquidity position continues to strengthen both quarter end in July, we issued $125 million up 4.5% unsecured notes due on July 26. From July 1 -- this is first quarter to August 4, 2021, we purchased an additional 44,000 shares at an average price of $13.46 for a total cost of $600,000, leaving approximately 24 million authorization for future purchases under the Board's current authorization.
